Challenge - solve the level and then come back and continue

question: Can you use b) instead of a)?
a) hero.attack('Kratt');
b) var enemy = 'Kratt';
hero.attack(enemy);
options: Yes, in example a) we use name the name 'Kratt' directly and in example b) we create a variable and assign 'Kratt' to it.
No, the second one would attack a character with the name 'enemy'

slides.text: If you successfuly finished the challenge, click to complete the lesson.
